#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2012 Report on Gender Equality and Development looks at women 's issues in India
#Text=Wednesday , September 25 , 2013
#Text=Yesterday , World Bank released its 2012 World Development Report on Gender Equality and Development .

#Text=India was mentioned over 300 times in the report , many more times than more developed countries like Spain which was mentioned 48 times , New Zealand which was mentioned 15 times , and Canada which was mentioned 22 times .

#Text=The report mentions the importance of gender equality for national development as it ties into improve productivity , improved outcomes for the next generation , and more representative decision making .
#Text=Across the board for India , improved gender equality on the local level led to improvements in sanitation , water supplies , irrigation , and schools .
#Text=School girls from Mumbai Image : the opoponax .
#Text=Nationally , the report found that a woman 's income correlated positively with the number of years her children spent in school .
#Text=There is no gender gap in male/female school attendance for the richest 20 % of Indian families , but males outnumber females by a ratio of 5 to 1 for the poorest 20 % of Indian families .
#Text=Girls in the bottom 20 % on average only finish Grade 1 while males finish Grade 6 .
#Text=By age 15 , according to Young Lives , Indian parents from Andhra Pradesh prioritize family outcomes for their male children over their female ones .
#Text=Indian women earn $ 0.64 for every $ 1 earned by their male counterparts .
#Text=They fare better proportionally than their female German counterparts who earn $ 0.62 and Georgia who earn $ 0.60 .
#Text=In the developing world , they lag behind Malawi where women earn $ 0.90 for every $ 1 earned by men , Egypt where women earn $ 0.82 , and Benin and Mexico at $ 0.80 .
#Text=A fifth of married Indian women , including those with their own income , do not make decisions on household spending .
#Text=The 18 % average puts Indian female control of their earnings equal to their counterparts in Mozambique .
#Text=India is between Nigeria at 14 % , and Zambia and Rwanda at 20 % .
#Text=Female activists from Bundelkhand , Uttar Pradesh Image : McKay Savage .
#Text=Indian women are having fewer children .
#Text=The report found that while it took 100 years for the average woman in the United States to go from having six children to having three , it took India only 35 years .
#Text=Women still have high maternal mortality rates , especially when compared to neighboring Sri Lanka .
#Text=India 's rate is six times as high .
#Text=Very young females still die at very high rates in India , especially in North India , because of gender preferences for male children .
#Text=While according to the report this trend is spreading nationally , the overall number of excess females deaths dropped by 8,000 from 265,000 in 1990 to 257,000 in 2008 .
#Text=In China , the total excess female deaths grew by 202,000 .
#Text=The report cites improved access to ultra-sound and similar technologies as a cause for the very high rates in both India and China because it allows parents to select the sex of their child .
#Text=In a national exception , the height of North Indian women increased more slowly and they had worse anthropometric outcomes proportional to their male counterparts .

#Text=Estimates by the World Bank report writers based on Demographic and Health Surveys suggest 15 % of Indian women think it is acceptable for a husband to beat his wife if she refuses to have sex with him , 20 % if she burns food and 30 % if she argues with him .
#Text=Economic well being plays a role in the number of children a woman has .
#Text=The richest 20 % of women average around 1.5 total children .
#Text=The poorest 20 % average about 4 children .
#Text=India 's poorest 20 % is comparable to Colombia and the Dominican Republic .
#Text=The number is much lower than many Afrian countries including Niger , Mali , Zambia , Malawi , Liberia , Nigeria , Tanzania and Kenya where the poorest 20 % average over 7 children .
#Text=The Indian gains highlighted include several local ones .
#Text=This includes using women 's self-help groups focused on taking best practices from research and applying them in farming in the state of Orissa .
#Text=The Self Employed Women ’s Association has assisted women in Gujarat by providing childcare .
#Text=Quotas for women elected in local governments led to changes in underlying beliefs about the effectiveness of women in government .
#Text=The creation of an all-women 's police force in Tamil Nadu led to increased reporting of crimes against women and general comfort in going to the police to report a problem .
#Text=The report offers several pieces of advice for Indian policy makers , including trying to change current role models to include more women who do not follow social norms .
#Text=It advises laws be created and enforced to prevent sex selection of children .
#Text=The report also encourages strengthening ownership and land rights , which should also address the agricultural productivity gender-gap .
